how can I become a registered teacher in NZ ,what are my alternative options if I do not the meet the reqirements
answer: You can speak to a Career Consultant (for 15 minutes) and ask any career-related questions. Each drop-in session is two hours long. Students cannot book in advance. Students are able to sign in to allocated time slots once they arrive at the drop in or wait to be let into the teams meeting if online Drop in thimes can be found through this link https://mycareer.waikato.ac.nz/students/appointments/app/topic/5?siteId=1

questions: How can I get the Employability Plus Award certificate after earning enough points for the Gold award ?
What is the process to receive the Employability Plus Award certificate after achieving Gold status ?
Can you guide me on how to obtain the Employability Plus Award certificate after reaching Gold level ?
What steps do I need to follow to get the Employability Plus Award certificate after earning Gold points ?
How do I claim my Employability Plus Award certificate after accumulating enough points for Gold ?
answer:
The award automatically tracks your progress. When you complete each section (Community, University, and Employability), you'll receive a certificate for Bronze, Silver, and Gold.
Once you finish the entire award, you'll get a final named certificate. You can also download it anytime from the last section of the award called “Congratulations.”
Please note it may take a few seconds to appear

questions: Can you confirm if I successfully booked my appointment Drop-ins ?
answer: I can't do this for you.You can instantly check your booking status by logging into MyCareer → “Appointments” tab.Still unsure or nothing shows? Email mycareer@waikato.ac.nz with your student ID and we'll verify for you.

questions: How do I join a voluntary opportunity ?
I want to volunteer ,what are the steps ?
What do I need to do to start volunteering ?
How can I get involved in volunteering ?
Can you guide me on how to volunteer ?
What are the requirements for volunteering ?
Where can I find volunteer opportunities ?
How do I sign up for volunteering ?
What is the process to become a volunteer ?
How can I start volunteering through Employability Plus ?
answer:
Great to hear you'd like to volunteer!
First, please join the Employability Plus Award. Once you've joined, you'll receive a welcome email with all the steps to begin your volunteering journey, including watching or attending an induction session.
Join here EPA: https://mycareer.waikato.ac.nz/s/epa

questions: I have attended two drop-in sessions with the Careers and Employability team. Do these count for EPA points ?
Do drop-in sessions and one-on-one appointments count toward EPA points ?
Can I earn EPA points by attending drop-in sessions and one-on-one appointments ?
How can I earn EPA points through drop-in sessions and one-on-one appointments ?
Are drop-in sessions and one-on-one appointments eligible for EPA points ?
answer:
Sorry, drop-in sessions and one-on-one appointments don't count toward EPA points.
You can earn points by attending workshops. You can view the workshop schedule here: https://mycareer.waikato.ac.nz/students/events?eventTypeIds=9&page=1&studentSiteId=1

questions: Do the EPA induction and Language Buddy training count for EPA points ? Do I need to fill out the EPA involvement form ?
Can I earn EPA points for completing the EPA induction and Language Buddy training ? Do I need to submit the EPA involvement form ?
Are the EPA induction and Language Buddy training eligible for EPA points ? Do I need to complete the EPA involvement form ?
How can I earn EPA points through the EPA induction and Language Buddy training ? Do I need to fill out the EPA involvement form ?
Do I need to submit the EPA involvement form to get points for the EPA induction and Language Buddy training ?
answer: Yes, you can collect points for both of these. They are each worth 2 points. Please watch the induction video (from 14.30sec)

questions: I signed up for the EPA and my status says submitted. Will I be able to create my profile once approved ?
After signing up for the EPA, my status shows as submitted. Can I create my profile once it's approved ?
What does it mean when my EPA status is submitted ? Will I be able to create my profile after approval ?
Can I create my EPA profile after my status changes from submitted to approved ?
answer: No profile is needed. You can now watch the induction video or attend an in person induction session which will advise on how to get started.

questions: How do to upload my CV on MyWIL ?
answer: Once you have your CV, log into your MyWIL account, go to the 'Forms' tab, click 'Edit', and submit the 'CV Review Form'.

questions: Would you recommend pasting a CV template into ChatGPT so it can help fill it out ?
answer: No, we do not advise doing this.Book and attend the workshop "AI Assit - Upgrade your Application Game " through the events link https://mycareer.waikato.ac.nz/students/events or/and Downlaod the Tip sheet "Using AI" https://mycareer.waikato.ac.nz/students/docs/detail/39?filename=Using-AI.pdf

questions: Do I need to submit a general cover letter in MyWIL for the Internship prgramme, or should I write a separate Cover letter for each of my referance?
cover letter submission for internships
answer: Your cover letter does not need to be submitted for review in MyWIL. Your cover letter will be sent to your internship selections when you follow the instructions in the 'Step 3: Internships' tab. Any review of your cover letter can be done through your MyCareer portal.Information can be seen through this link https://www.waikato.ac.nz/about/faculties-schools/management/student-experience/work-integrated-learning/

questions: How do I add points ?
answer:
To add points to your award, please make sure you've signed up for the EPA. https://mycareer.waikato.ac.nz/s/epa
Then watch the induction session here https://mycareer.waikato.ac.nz/students/links/detail/3 — it walks you through the whole process (the section on adding roles starts at 14:30).
If you still need help, email employabilityplus@waikato.ac.nz

answer: Once you have your CV, log into your MyWIL account, go to the 'Forms' tab, click 'Edit', and submit the 'CV Review Form'.
